[[Albuquerque]], [[New Mexico]] | chain = [[Global Hyatt Corporation]] | opening_date = 1990 | coordinates = {{coord|35.0862|-106.6507|region:US_type:landmark|display=inline,title}} | developer = [[HCB Contractors]] | architect = [[Hellmuth, Obata & Kassabaum]] | operator = [[Hyatt Hotels]] | owner = Allegiance Realty Corporation | number_of_rooms = 395 | number_of_suites = 14 | number_of_restaurants = McGrath's Bar and Grill | floor_area = | floors = 20 | height = {{convert|78.03|m|abbr=on}} | parking = | website = [http://albuquerque.hyatt.com www.albuquerque.hyatt.com] | footnotes = {{emporis|129668}}{{skyscraperpage|2236}}{{structurae|s0034888}} }} '''Hyatt Regency Albuquerque''' is a 20-story highrise hotel located at 330 Tijeras Avenue NW in downtown [[Albuquerque]], [[New Mexico]]. The building is {{convert|78|m|abbr=on}} tall, making it Albuquerque's second tallest building and tallest hotel. It was built in 1990 as part of the Albuquerque Plaza mixed-use complex on the south side of Civic Plaza, which also includes the [[Albuquerque Plaza]] tower. The Albuquerque Plaza complex was designed by [[Hellmuth, Obata, & Kassabaum]] and built in 1990. ==Amenities== The hotel offers a Southwestern decor with a mountain or city view, and is the only [[four-diamond]] accommodation in downtown Albuquerque. McGrath's Bar & Grill offers fine dining the standard cafe and the services the lobby lounge. Other amenities include a heated rooftop pool, hot tubs, 24-hour attended gym.
